INTERSHOP IOM 4.5.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 7c6687974e94a88c22f9852e633617d9dad9fe4a)

Table oms.Shop2OrderPosStatesDefDO

Order position state naming as used by the shop instead of defaults.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
[[OrderPosStatesDefDO]][1] orderPosStatesDefRef integer NOT_NULL The order position state that should have a shop-specific naming. 
shopOrderPosStatesName varchar(50) The name of the order position state as used by the shop instead of defaults. Depends on the position state of the order state service. Example "initial" 
ShopDO shopRef bigint NOT_NULL The shop the order position state should be used for. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.
